finding: Using public cloud offerings makes complex software more accesible.
statedBy: Tjek, ThoughtWorks, MediaAtHand, Google, DigitalOcean, Microsoft

finding: Cloud providers' should be delivering simple tools and managed services.
statedBy: IBM, DigitalOcean, ThoughtWorks, MediaAtHand, Google, Microsoft

finding: Cloud tools hide complexity from the user.
Complexity can be handled by out-sourcing parts of the system to cloud.
It is easier to operate in cloud vs. on-premise.
Cloud is a good tool for prototyping.
It is difficult to choose the right cloud tools.
Cloud decreases control over the software.
The goal of cloud is to drive businesses forward.
Cloud tools automate typical operations tasks.
Cloud tools are automating highly complex operations.
It is easier to scale and deliver services trough public cloud.
Hiding complexity makes troubleshooting problems more difficult.
Cloud increases complexity.
Technical complexity should be handled by cloud vendor.
Cloud increases cost-efficiency.
Cloud makes it easier for businesses to react to market needs.
Unclear pricing schemas are a problem in cloud.
Developer experience is an important factor when choosing a cloud provider.
Using open-source software in cloud makes troubleshooting easier.
Complexity can be addressed by increasing transparency of cloud tools.
Training should be the goal of cloud providers.
Cross-functional teams can deal with complexity better.
Companies should be breaking knowledge silos.
Complexity can be handled by providing users with easy-to-use tooling.
Cloud complexity is decreasing.
Cloud vendors should be reliable.
Developer experience can be evaluated by interviewing engineers.
